_meanings:
{@--16@} A particular 
position in sexual intercourse, or a 
particular mode of sexual enjoyment
(these are said in <ls>Ratimañjarī</ls> to be
16, but other writers increase the
number to 84).

{@--18@} Arrangement of a
stanza in a particular shape; {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%}
{#KaqgabaMDa, padmabaMDa, murajabaMDa#} (vide  
<ls>K. P. 9.</ls> {%ad loc.%}).

{@--23@} A disease in
which the eyelids cannot be wholly
closed.

a complete army
containing the four necessary 
elements, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} elephants, horses, chariots
and footmen.

forced or 
unnatural construction of words.

a post to which an animal
({%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} an elephant) is tied.
